alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 12:40PM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff. * WHERE...A portion of Southern Greenville County in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 PM EST, As runoff from this morning`s and last night`s heavy rainfall continues to work south through the Lower Reedy River, developing out of bank conditions and flooding of low-lying areas is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fork Shoals. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
